005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter.MetaschemaDataTypeProvider;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CollectionUtil;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.LinkedList;
013import java.util.List;
014import java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock;
015import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReadWriteLock;
016import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock;
017
018import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
019
020/**
021 * A base implementation of an {@link IDataTypeProvider}, supporting dynamic
022 * loading of Metaschema data type extensions at runtime.
023 * <p>
024 * The {@link MetaschemaDataTypeProvider} class provides an example of how to
025 * use this class to provide new data types.
026 */
027public abstract class AbstractDataTypeProvider implements IDataTypeProvider {
028  @NonNull
029  private final List<IDataTypeAdapter<?>> library = new LinkedList<>();
030  @NonNull
031  private final ReadWriteLock libraryLock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock();
032
033  @Override
034  public List<? extends IDataTypeAdapter<?>> getJavaTypeAdapters() {
035    Lock readLock = libraryLock.readLock();
036    readLock.lock();
037    try {
038      // make a defensive copy to protect callers from potential modifications
039      return CollectionUtil.unmodifiableList(new ArrayList<>(library));
040    } finally {
041      readLock.unlock();
042    }
043  }
044
045  /**
046   * Register the provided {@code adapter} with the type system.
047   *
048   * @param adapter
049   *          the adapter to register
050   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
051   *           if another type adapter has no name
052   */
053  protected void registerDatatype(@NonNull IDataTypeAdapter<?> adapter) {
054    if (adapter.getNames().isEmpty()) {
055      throw new IllegalArgumentException("The adapter has no name: " + adapter.getClass().getName());
056    }
057    Lock writeLock = libraryLock.writeLock();
058    writeLock.lock();
059    try {
060      library.add(adapter);
061    } finally {
062      writeLock.unlock();
063    }
064  }
065}
